law.catch_line: Officer's conduct does not estop contest of tax or indebtedness.
law.text: No conduct, statement, or representation of any officer of any county, city, or taxing district, shall serve to estop the county, city or taxing district from contesting the legality of any tax or indebtedness authorized or created by it in excess of the constitutional or legal limits relating thereto.
law.history: Amended 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 88, secs. 80 and 93, effective July 1, 1992. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 1649c-1.

metadata.note: Amendment of this section by 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 88, secs. 80 and 93 became effective July 1, 1992, in compliance with 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 324, sec. 30.
